1048070961277362177.text: 18/ For anyone who is very familiar with ridesharing vs taxis, there's no debate - ridesharing feels magical, and the Halifax taxi system feels like a step back in time - and not in a good way! Haligonians deserve ridesharing - and we need it very much to be competitive and grow.

1048070959863947264.text: 17/  Uber's current mission statement is something like, "Igniting human potential by unlocking mobility."

1048070958647533568.text: 16/ If you need bridge income, you can drive Uber. It may not be all $70 airport runs, but this is where the industry is going. The truth is, these jobs are going away soon anyway as autonomous vehicle technology becomes perfected.

1048070957393489922.text: 15/  Another young woman in the Bay Area quit her job at a toxic workplace and was able to start driving Uber while she figured out what was next.

1048070955912912899.text: 14/  One young ex-soldier in Austin, Texas, had had a health scare and a divorce, sold everything, and worked his way through the southern US driving Uber on his great American road trip.

1048070954788765696.text: 13/  I've met an Uber driver in Boulder, Colorado, who was supplementing her income as an author and marital therapist.

1048070953568280576.text: 12/ Regarding the economics, something the gig economy, and driving for Uber provides, which has been overlooked by the couple of recent hitpieces I've seen, is that it increases employment elasticity amongst the wider populace.

1048070952339345408.text: 11/ The economics of the taxi industry are changing. I have empathy for the drivers. But we're all dealing with change, and we can't protect industries from innovation, especially with a far inferior and obsolete product, which the Halifax taxi system really is.

1048070951118802944.text: 10/ I've taken 200+ Uber rides this year in dozens of the U.S. and Canada's biggest cities and smallest towns. I've taken dozens of Halifax taxis over the same period, and I can say without reservation, that Uber is a much, much, much better product and experience.

1048070949826961408.text: 9/  Oh yeah, debit costs an extra dollar. (What?)

1048070948585394176.text: 8/ Not to mention the completely lack of the modern experience of simply exiting the vehicle at the conclusion of the ride. (Great anytime, but especially when you're in a hurry or at a congested drop-off spot!)

1048070947243261952.text: 7/ Twice in the last week, I've had to wait in the taxi while the payment terminals had difficulty connecting to the network to pay.

1048070945943015424.text: 6/  I took a Casino Taxi to the office on Tuesday. It reeked so much like cigarette smoke, I was gagging. Nothing new, but this time it was particularly bad. I spent the ride with the window down, in the rain, trying to suck in some fresh air.

1048070944001073152.text: 5/ That same day, my girlfriend picked me up at my office in a cab after work. The (Casino Taxi) driver told her that it was the worst place to stop, and if they got hit from behind, he would "beat her up".

1048070942600192001.text: 4/ Yellow Cab showed up 15 minutes later, and the driver seemed surprised I got a car so quickly  -  he said wait times had been upwards of 45 minutes.  *Never* seen a wait time like that in a ridesharing city.

1048070941312503808.text: 3/  Last Friday, the Casino Taxi app had been malfunctioning for days. It was raining, and I couldn't get through on the phone, so I called Yellow.

1048070940029059072.text: 2/ It was 10pm and people were confusedly lining up at the YHZ Ground Transportation window.  Lots of people flying in from other cities wondering why their Uber app wasn't working and how they were supposed to get into Halifax.

997257675288203264.text: 15/ We're supercharging #Ethereum e-commerce. Join us! Drop in to our Telegram channel https://t.me/GroundhogNetwork …, follow us on Twitter: @GroundhogPay, and enter your email on https://groundhog.network  to get the latest updates on Groundhog and claim your spot on the waitlist.

997257584473030656.text: 14/ Anyone can be an Operator. Operators on the Groundhog Network are incentivized by a combination of 1) a percentage of the transaction fee and/or 2) Groundhog tokens.

997257506446426118.text: 13/ In the spirit of true decentralization, the Groundhog Network will run nodes called Operators in order to perform the ongoing smart contract calls necessary to run the network, including those required on behalf of merchants to pull payments.

997257428239462400.text: 12/ With our simple SDK, API and plug-ins, we allow #dApp developers to integrate @GroundhogPay into their platforms so users can easily access and spend their proprietary token without reinventing the wheel every time.

997257335725682690.text: 11/ We're enabling the Decentralized app economy. There are thousands of blockchain-based projects with their own proprietary tokens, but nobody has really figured out the rails of how users can easily acquire and spend these tokens in a friction-free way.

997257229098106886.text: 10/ We believe this will be a major advancement for the #Ethereum ecosystem and be a catalyzing factor in the continued adoption of cryptocurrencies as payments. Thanks to @owocki of @getgitcoin for kicking off this ERC and to everyone who has contributed so far.

997257068661825537.text: 9/ We're part of the working group developing ERC-948, the new proposed standard for subscription payments on Ethereum. ERC-948 + Groundhog will start feeling more like a credit card, and enable a whole new world of convenience and subscription models for users and companies.

997256920477024256.text: 8/ Some merchants want the flexibility of accepting cryptocurrencies while reducing exposure to their volatility. Groundhog will support stablecoins such as @MakerDAO, @basisprotocol, and @havven_io so that merchants can instantly settle into fiat or fiat-tracking currencies.

997256793603502080.text: 7/ And because you have your own dedicated smart contract holding your funds, you can easily verify your balance and transactions independently at any time.

997256722283577345.text: 6/ Smart contract logic ensures payments are only pulled when, how, and by whom they are permitted to. You can pause, change or cancel your subscriptions at any time.

997256681863110656.text: 5/ With Groundhog, you're the only one in control of your private keys. You can deploy and manage your Groundhog subscriptions with multiple devices, including our iOS or Android apps, a hardware wallet such as a Ledger, or a browser extension like MetaMask.

997256558869233665.text: 4/ Merchants can install @GroundhogPay by just adding a few lines of code to their website or app, and instantly start accepting recurring subscription payments on #Ethereum from anyone with a Groundhog Wallet.

997256492226039808.text: 3/ And @GroundhogPay, a payment platform that lets merchants virtually anywhere in the world take payments in all types of cryptocurrencies including subscription payments over Ethereum.

997256404887977987.text: 2/ The Groundhog Network is composed of The Groundhog Wallet, a free, multi-blockchain crypto wallet, browser, and hub for your decentralized life,

997256177309306882.text: 1/ Recurring subscription payments are the next big thing in #blockchain. That's one of the reasons we're building @GroundhogPay  -  to supercharge #Ethereum e-commerce.
